question: Which member of the human mycobiota is associated to atherosclerosis?
ideal_answer: Mucor racemosus is negatively associated with carotid atherosclerosis

snippets.text: Interestingly, the relative abundance of Mucor racemosus was negatively associated both with FRS and cIMT.

Variable importance in projection scores showed that M. racemosus abundance had the same impact in the model as waist-to-hip ratio, high-density lipoprotein-cholesterol, fasting triglycerides or fasting glucose, suggesting that M. racemosus relative abundance in the gut may be a relevant biomarker for cardiovascular risk.
